jobDescription: E2173:Data Warehouse Analyst Sr  14-Jun-2018 Req ID437671BRLMCareers Business UnitESS6500 RMSWork Schedule FLEX-Non-Standard 40 hour week Security Clearance Secret Shift First Direct/Indirect Direct Business Area Rotary and Mission Systems Department 70056:Logistics Relocation/Housing Stipend Available Possible Job Code/Title E2173:Data Warehouse Analyst Sr Job Class Logistics Job Category Experienced Professional Program F-35 Sustainment Industry Job Title Data Warehouse Analyst Sr Req Type Full-Time Job Description At Lockheed Martin Mission Systems and Training, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training and education. Come and experience your future!  The selected candidate will be responsible for providing technical Engineering knowledge and skills supporting F-35 Program Sustainment Data Product Integration & Delivery (SDP I&D;) and Sustainment Support activities within the Data Quality & Integration Management (DQIM) Team's LDM & Supplier Integration group. The candidate will perform Sustainment Data Product (SDP) integration, research/analysis, processing, and handling data exchanges between Program Stakeholders and Systems, Suppliers, Teammates, Propulsion System Contractors, Internal Data Authors and Operational Sites.  Specific tasks include, but as a minimum: Support coordination with assigned users, application teams, and Suppliers, to understand issues and needs; prioritizing, determining solutions, and implementation of Electronic Equipment Logbook (EEL) resolution.Support reviews, processing, and pursue approval for delivery of F-35 SDP to support aircraft or equipment deliveries and site operations or JSF site standup. to include, but not limited to:Perform data modeling/mapping/mining and Extraction, Transformation and Loading(ETL) activitiesApply data quality forensics and participate in assessments of SDP and/or Supplier data submissionsSupport coordination with assigned users, application teams, and Suppliers, to understand issues and needs; prioritizing, determining solutions, and implementation of Action Requests (AR) resolutionSupport the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints**Must be a US Citizen or legally authorized to work in US as a permanent resident. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.***Basic Qualifications Understand Basic Systems Engineering Principles as it applies to systems and data integration Outstanding interpersonal and problem solving skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneouslyPerforming data quality audits/verificationApplication of Data Modeling, Profiling or Analysis
